text.text_translated: Ed Stafford from the UK is the first person who has walked the entire length of the Amazon River. His 6,000-kilometre walk started at a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and finished two years and four months later at the river's mouth in Brazil. The Amazon rainforest is home to poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguars, so Ed was in constant danger. However, he was lucky and survived with nothing worse than a few thousand bites from mosquitoes and ants.
